==Sindarin==

'''''malt''''' is a [[Sindarin]] word meaning "[[gold]]".<ref name=VT42>{{VT|42c}}, p. 27 (Note 5)</ref> 

[[David Salo]] has suggested the [[Neo-Elvish|Neo-Sindarin]] word ''malad'', or ''malt'', meaning "gold (metal)".<ref>{{HM|GS}}, p. 324</ref>

===Examples===

*''[[Mallorn#Etymology|mallorn]]'' (''malt'' + ''[[orn]]'')<ref name=VT42/><ref name=SApp/>
*''[[Malduin]]''<ref name=SApp>{{S|Appendix}}</ref>
*''[[Laurelin#Names|Malinalda]]''<ref name=SApp/>
*''[[Cormallen]]''<ref name=SApp/>

==Noldorin==

'''''malt''''' is a [[Noldorin]] word meaning "[[gold]] (as metal)".<ref name=LR386>{{LR|Etymologies}}, p. 386</ref>

===Etymoloy===

*[[Sundocarme|Root]] [[SMAL]]<ref name=LR386/>

===Other versions===

A rejected Noldorin word for "gold (metal)" was '''''côl''''', derived from root [[KUL]].<ref>{{LR|Etymologies}}, p. 365</ref>

==See also==

*Prefix ''[[mal-]]''
*[[Quenya]] ''[[malda]]''
*[[Sundocarme|Root]] [[MALAT]]
